did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Minute Book of the New England Land Company (Phoenix, Ariz.), 1890-1897
did.abstract: The New England Land Company was a corporation which promoted land development, especially irrigation, in the area of the Salt River Valley, Maricopa County. This collection contains holograph record of minutes of meetings of the stockholders and board of directors, 1890-1897. Includes copies of Articles of Incorporation and By-laws.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Minute Book of the New England Land Company (Phoenix, Ariz.) (AZ 233). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired as gift of Clay Lockett, 1962.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Corporation which promoted land development, especially irrigation, in the area of the Salt River Valley, Maricopa County. Principal stockholder was the Arizona Improvement Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Holograph record of minutes of meetings of the stockholders and board of directors, 1890-1897. Includes copies of Articles of Incorporation and By-laws.
